place.name: BAYVIL
place.gazetteerText: BAYVILL, a parish in the district of Cardigan and county of Pembroke; on the river Nevern, 3½ miles ENE of Newport, and 6½ SW of Cardigan r. station. Post Town, Newport, under Haverfordwest. Acres, 1,344. Real property, £1,195. Pop., 118. Houses, 29. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage, united with the vicarage of Moylgrove, in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £224. Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
